data.name: Forretress
data.flavorText: Its entire body is shielded by a steel-hard shell. What lurks inside this shell is a total mystery.

attacks.name: Mirror Shot
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Everyone Explode Now
attacks.text: Does 30 damage times the number of Pineco and Forretress you have in play. This attack does 30 damage to each of your Pineco and Forretress in play.

data.name: Bellossom
data.flavorText: Bellossom gather at times and seem to dance. They say that the dance is a ritual to summon the sun.

abilities.name: Hustle Step
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may remove 1 damage counter from each of your Pokémon. This power can't be used if Bellossom is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Dance 'til Dawn
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads. Bellossom is now Asleep.

data.name: Espeon
data.flavorText: It uses the fine hair that covers its body to sense air currents and predict its enemy's actions.

attacks.name: Solar Suggestion
attacks.text: Move up to 4 damage counters from any of your Pokémon to any of your opponent's Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Psybeam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Gliscor
data.flavorText: Its flight is soundless. It uses its lengthy tail to carry off its prey… Then its elongated fangs do the rest.

attacks.name: Ninja Fang
attacks.text: If, before Gliscor does damage, the Defending Pokémon has no damage counters on it and is then damaged by this attack (after applying Weakness and Resistance), the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Poison Jab
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Houndoom
data.flavorText: Upon hearing its eerie howls, other Pokémon get the shivers and head straight back to their nests.

attacks.name: Fire Counterattack
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Fighting Pokémon in play, this attack does 20 damage plus 60 more damage.

attacks.name: Dark Roar
attacks.text: Your opponent discards a card from his or her hand.

data.name: Magcargo
data.flavorText: Its brittle shell occasionally spouts intense flames that circulate throughout its body.

attacks.name: Searing Flame
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Lava Flow
attacks.text: You may discard any number of Fire Energy cards attached to Magcargo. If you do , this attack does 60 damage plus 20 more damage for each Fire Energy card you discarded.

data.name: Smeargle
data.flavorText: Once it becomes an adult, it has a tendency to let its comrades plant footprints on its back.

abilities.name: Portrait
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Smeargle is your Active Pokémon, you may look at your opponent's hand. If you do, choose a Supporter card you find there and use the effect of that card as the effect of this power. This power can't be used if Smeargle is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Tail Rap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Scizor
data.flavorText: Its wings are not used for flying. They are flapped at high speed to adjust its body temperature.

data.name: Umbreon
data.flavorText: When agitated, this Pokémon protects itself by spraying poisonous sweat from its pores.

attacks.name: Moonlight Fang
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects, including damage, done to Umbreon by attacks from your opponent's Pokémon that has any Poké-Powers or Poké-Bodies.

attacks.name: Quick Blow
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 30 damage.

data.name: Togekiss
data.flavorText: As everyone knows, it visits peaceful regions, bringing them gifts of kindness and sweet blessings.

attacks.name: Blessed Wings
attacks.text: Remove all damage counters from each of your Pokémon. Shuffle Togekiss and all cards attached to it back into your deck.

attacks.name: Air Cutter
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Dodrio
data.flavorText: It collects data and plans three times as wisely, but it may think too much and fall into a state of immobility.

abilities.name: Retreat Aid
abilities.text: As long as Dodrio is on your Bench, your Active Pokémon's Retreat Cost is ColorlessColorless less.

attacks.name: Incessant Peck
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage for each heads.

data.name: Drifblim
data.flavorText: It can generate and release gas within its body. That's how it can control the altitude of its drift.

attacks.name: Balloon Tackle
attacks.text: Drifblim does 20 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Take Away
attacks.text: Shuffle Drifblim and all cards attached to it back into your deck. Then, your opponent shuffles the Defending Pokémon and all cards attached to it into his or her deck. (You choose your new Active Pokémon first.)

data.name: Forretress
data.flavorText: It remains immovably rooted to its tree. It scatters pieces of its hard shell to drive its enemies away.

attacks.name: Spike Spread
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Gyro Ball
attacks.text: You may switch Forretress with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. If you do, your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Hariyama
data.flavorText: It loves challenging others to tests of strength. It has the power to stop a train with a slap.

attacks.name: Backward Belt Throw
attacks.text: You may do 80 damage plus 20 more damage. If you do, Hariyama does 20 damage to itself.

data.name: Honchkrow
data.flavorText: It is merciless by nature. It is said that it never forgives the mistakes of its Murkrow followers.

attacks.name: Shadow Bind
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Vengeance
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each Darkness Pokémon in your discard pile.

data.name: Leafeon
data.flavorText: When you see Leafeon asleep in a patch of sunshine, you'll know it is using photosynthesis to produce clean air.

attacks.name: Miasma Wind
attacks.text: Does 50 damage damage times the number of Special Conditions affecting the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Soothing Scent
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Honchkrow
data.flavorText: It is merciless by nature. It is said that it never forgives the mistakes of its Murkrow followers.

attacks.name: Whirlwind
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Blindside
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon that has any damage counters on it. This attack does 50 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Mismagius
data.flavorText: Its cries sound like incantations to torment the foe. It appears where you least expect it.

attacks.name: Sleeping Spell
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Poltergeist
attacks.text: Look at your opponent's hand. This attack does 30 damage times the number of Trainer, Supporter, and Stadium cards in your opponent's hand.]

data.name: Metagross
data.flavorText: It folds its four legs when flying. Its four brains are said to be superior to a supercomputer.

attacks.name: Quad Smash
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 50 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Rotom
data.flavorText: Research continues on this Pokémon, which could be the power source of a unique motor.

abilities.name: Mischievous Trick
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may switch 1 of your face-down Prize cards with the top card of your deck. This power can't be used if Rotom is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Plasma Arrow
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage for each Energy attached to that Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

data.name: Tropius
data.flavorText: The bunch of fruit around its neck ripens twice a year and is delicious. It's a highly favored tropical snack.

attacks.name: Fresh-Picked Fruit
attacks.text: Remove 6 damage counters from 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Skarmory
data.flavorText: After nesting in bramble bushes, the wings of its chicks grow hard from scratches by thorns.

attacks.name: Steel Coat
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Metal Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Vespiquen
data.flavorText: It raises grubs in the holes in its body. It secretes pheromones to control Combee.

abilities.name: Defense Sign
abilities.text: Prevent all damage done to your Benched Grass Pokémon by attacks.

attacks.name: Mach Wind
attacks.text: During your next turn, Vespiquen's Retreat Cost is 0.

data.name: Vileplume
data.flavorText: It has the world's largest petals. With every step, the petals shake out heavy clouds of toxic pollen.

abilities.name: Allergy Flower
abilities.text: Each player can't play any Trainer cards from his or her hand.

attacks.name: Dazzling Pollen
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 50 damage plus 20 more damage. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Weavile
data.flavorText: It lives in snowy regions. It carves patterns in trees with its claws as a signal to others.

abilities.name: Claw Snag
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you play Weavile from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may look at your opponent's hand. Choose a card from your opponent's hand and discard it.

attacks.name: Feint Attack
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on that Pokémon.

data.name: Flareon
data.flavorText: It stores some of the air it inhales in its internal flame pouch, which heats it to over 3,000 degrees Fahrenheit.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to Flareon.

data.name: Gloom
data.flavorText: What appears to be drool is actually sweet honey. It is very sticky and clings stubbornly if touched.

attacks.name: Miracle Powder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 Special Condition. The Defending Pokémon is now affected by that Special Condition.

data.name: Muk
data.flavorText: Its body is made of a powerful poison. Touching it accidentally will cause a fever that requires bed rest.

attacks.name: Sludge Drag
attacks.text: Switch the Defending Pokémon with 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. The new Defending Pokémon is now Confused and Poisoned.

attacks.name: Pester
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is affected by a Special Condition, this attack does 50 damage plus 30 more damage.

data.name: Lairon
data.flavorText: It loves iron ore. Groups of them fight for territory by bashing one another with their steel bodies.

attacks.name: Scrap Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your discard pile for a Metal Energy card and attach it to Lairon.

data.name: Jolteon
data.flavorText: It concentrates the weak electric charges emitted by its cells and launches wicked lightning bolts.

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Jolteon during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Metang
data.flavorText: When two Beldum fuse together, a magnetic nervous system places their brains in union.

attacks.name: Double Smash
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 50 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Pinsir
data.flavorText: With its horns, it digs burrows to sleep in at night. In the morning, damp soil clings to its body.

attacks.name: Charging Horn
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage.

data.name: Raticate
data.flavorText: Its whiskers help it to maintain balance. Its fangs never stop growing, so it gnaws to pare them down.

attacks.name: Razor-Sharp Incisors
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the number of damage counters on the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Gnaw Up
attacks.text: Discard a Special Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Raichu
data.flavorText: When its electricity builds, its muscles are stimulated, and it becomes more aggressive than usual.

attacks.name: Spark
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Sableye
data.flavorText: It dwells in the darkness of caves. It uses its sharp claws to dig up gems to nourish itself.

attacks.name: Pull Out
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for any 1 card, show it to your opponent, and put it on top of your deck.

attacks.name: Dark Hand
attacks.text: If you have more cards in your hand than your opponent, this attack does 20 damage plus 30 more damage.

data.name: Scyther
data.flavorText: When it moves, it leaves only a blur. If it hides in grass, its protective colors make it invisible.

attacks.name: Afterimage Strike
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, if Scyther would be damaged by an attack, flip a coin. If heads, prevent that attack's damage done to Scyther.

data.name: Skuntank
data.flavorText: It attacks by spraying a repugnant fluid from its tail, but the stench dulls after a few squirts.

attacks.name: Stun Gas
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Slowbro
data.flavorText: Naturally dull to begin with, it lost its ability to feel pain due to Shellder's seeping poison.

attacks.name: Full-Belly Refresh
attacks.text: Remove all Special Conditions and 3 damage counters from Slowbro.

attacks.name: Startling Trip
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused. If tails, Slowbro is now Confused.

data.name: Togetic
data.flavorText: It grows dispirited if it is not with kind people. It can float in midair without moving its wings.

attacks.name: Chase Up
attacks.text: Search your deck for any 1 card and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Fly
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage done to Togetic during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Unown
data.flavorText: Their shapes look like hieroglyphs on ancient tablets. It is said that the two are somehow related.

abilities.name: DARK
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you put Unown from your hand onto your Bench, you may search your deck for a Darkness Energy card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Beldum
data.flavorText: The magnetic force generated by its body repels the ground's natural magnetism, letting it float.

attacks.name: Single Smash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Vaporeon
data.flavorText: When Vaporeon's fins begin to vibrate, it is a sign that rain will come within a few hours.

attacks.name: Spiral Drain
attacks.text: Remove 2 damage counters from Vaporeon.

attacks.name: Dual Splash
attacks.text: Choose 2 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to each of them. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Aron
data.flavorText: When it evolves, it sheds the steel carapace that covered its whole body and develops a new one.

attacks.name: Metal Sound
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Doduo
data.flavorText: By alternately raising and lowering its two heads, it balances itself to be more stable while running.

attacks.name: Double Headstrike
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If either of them is tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Drifloon
data.flavorText: It is whispered that any child who mistakes Drifloon for a balloon and holds on to it could wind up missing.

attacks.name: Minimize
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Drifloon by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Pull
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, switch the Defending Pokémon with 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Combee
data.flavorText: At night, Combee sleep in a group of about a thousand, packed closely together in a lump.

attacks.name: Enraged Assault
attacks.text: If Vespiquen is on your Bench and has any damage counters on it, this attack does 20 damage plus 60 more damage and the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Eevee
data.flavorText: It has the ability to alter the composition of its body to suit its surrounding environment.

data.name: Eevee
data.flavorText: Its irregularly configured DNA is affected by its surroundings. It evolves if its environment changes.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Tickle
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Gligar
data.flavorText: It flies straight at its target's face then clamps down on the startled victim to inject poison.

attacks.name: Stun Poison
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed and Poisoned.

data.name: Houndour
data.flavorText: It uses different kinds of cries for communicating with others of its kind and for pursuing its prey.

data.name: Hitmonlee
data.flavorText: If it starts kicking repeatedly, both legs will stretch even longer to strike a fleeing foe.

data.name: Houndour
data.flavorText: To corner prey, they check each other's location using barks that only they can understand.

attacks.name: Jump On
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage.

data.name: Grimer
data.flavorText: Wherever Grimer has passed, so many germs are left behind that no plants will ever grow again.

attacks.name: Sticky Liquid
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon's Retreat Cost is Colorless more.

data.name: Hitmonchan
data.flavorText: Its punches slice the air. However, it seems to need a short break after fighting for three minutes.

attacks.name: Detect
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attack, including damage, done to Hitmonchan during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Sky Uppercut
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

data.name: Makuhita
data.flavorText: It toughens up by slamming into thick trees over and over. It gains a sturdy body and dauntless spirit.

attacks.name: Slap Down
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each heads.

data.name: Mawile
data.flavorText: It chomps with its gaping mouth. Its huge jaws are actually steel horns that have been transformed.

attacks.name: Selfish Draw
attacks.text: Look at the top card of your deck. You may put it into your hand. If not, discard it and draw a card.

attacks.name: Destructive Jaw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed and discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Misdreavus
data.flavorText: It loves to bite and yank people's hair from behind without warning, just to see their shocked reactions.

attacks.name: Dual Draw
attacks.text: Each player draws 3 cards.

data.name: Murkrow
data.flavorText: Feared and loathed by many, it is believed to bring misfortune to all those who see it at night.

attacks.name: Astonish
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 card from your opponent's hand without looking. Look at the card you chose, then have your opponent shuffle that card into his or her deck.

data.name: Murkrow
data.flavorText: It is said that when chased, it lures its attacker onto dark mountain trails where the foe will get lost.

data.name: Oddish
data.flavorText: Awakened by moonlight, it roams actively at night. In the day it stays quietly underground.

attacks.name: Find a Friend
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a Grass Pokémon, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Pikachu
data.flavorText: This intelligent Pokémon roasts hard berries with electricity to make them tender enough to eat.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Pineco
data.flavorText: It hangs and waits for flying insect prey to come near. It does not move about much on its own.

data.name: Pineco
data.flavorText: It likes to make its shell thicker by adding layers of tree bark. The additional weight doesn't bother it.

attacks.name: Focus Energy
attacks.text: During your next turn, Pineco's Surprise Attack attack's base damage is 80.

attacks.name: Surprise Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Rattata
data.flavorText: Living wherever there is food available, it ceaselessly scavenges for edibles the entire day.

data.name: Scyther
data.flavorText: It slashes through grass with its sharp scythes, moving too fast for the human eye to track.

attacks.name: Slashing Strike
attacks.text: During your next turn, Scyther can't use Slashing Strike.

data.name: Slowpoke
data.flavorText: A sweet sap leaks from its tail's tip. Although not nutritious, the tail is pleasant to chew on.

attacks.name: Rambunctious Party
attacks.text: Look at the top 5 cards of your deck. Choose as many Basic Pokémon as you like and put them onto your Bench. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.

data.name: Sneasel
data.flavorText: Vicious in nature, it drives Pidgey from their nests and scavenges any leftovers it can find.

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Beat Up
attacks.text: Flip a coin for each of your Pokémon in play. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Stunky
data.flavorText: The foul fluid from its rear is so revolting that it can make people feel queasy up to a mile and a quarter away.

attacks.name: Double Scratch
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

data.name: Slugma
data.flavorText: A common sight in volcanic areas, it slowly slithers around in a constant search for warm places.

abilities.name: Active Volcano
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard the top card of your deck. If that card is a Fire Energy card, attach it to Slugma. This power can't be used if Slugma is affected by a Special Condition.

data.name: Burned Tower
rules: This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

Once during each player's turn, that player may flip a coin. If heads, the player searches his or her discard pile for a basic Energy card, shows it to his or her opponent, and put it into his or her hand.

data.name: Togepi
data.flavorText: A proverb claims that happiness will come to anyone who can make a sleeping Togepi stand up.

attacks.name: Plead
attacks.text: Ask your opponent if you may draw 2 cards. If yes, draw 2 cards. If no, this attack does 20 damage to the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Defender
rules: Attach Defender to 1 of your Pokémon. Discard this card at the end of your opponent's next turn. Any damage done to the Pokémon Defender is attached to by an opponent's attack is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Energy Exchanger
rules: Choose an Energy card from your hand, show it to your opponent, and put it on top of your deck. Search your deck for an Energy card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Ruins of Alph
rules: This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.
Each Pokémon in play has no Resistance.

data.name: Flower Shop Lady
rules: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.
Search your discard pile for 3 Pokémon and 3 basic Energy cards. Show them to your opponent and shuffle them into your deck.

data.name: Legend Box
rules: Reveal the top 10 cards of your deck. If you reveal both halves of a Pokémon LEGEND, put those cards onto your Bench and attach all revealed Energy cards to that Pokémon LEGEND. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck. (You can play only 1 Pokémon LEGEND in this way.)

data.name: Sage's Training
rules: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.
Look at the top 5 cards of your deck. Choose any 2 cards you find there and put them into your hand. Discard the other cards.

data.name: Darkness Energy
rules: If the Pokémon Darkness Energy is attached to attacks, the attack does 10 more damage to the Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance). Ignore this effect if the Pokémon that Darkness Energy is attached to isn't Darkness. Darkness Energy provides Darkness Energy. (Doesn't count as a basic Energy card.)

data.name: Team Rocket's Trickery
rules: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.
Draw 2 cards. Then, your opponent discards a card from his or her hand.

data.name: Metal Energy
rules: Damage done by attacks to the Pokémon that Metal Energy is attached to is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance). Ignore this effect if the Pokémon that Metal Energy is attached to isn't Metal Metal Energy provides Metal Energy. (Doesn't count as a basic Energy card.)

abilities.name: Evolution Memories
abilities.text: Espeon can use the attacks of all Pokémon you have in play that evolve from Eevee as its own. (You still need the necessary Energy to use each attack.)

attacks.name: Solar Ray
attacks.text: Remove 1 damage counter from each of your Pokémon.

abilities.name: Fire Breath
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned. This power can't be used if Houndoom is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Dark Clamp
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

abilities.name: Voltage Increase
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may move a Lightning Energy attached to 1 of your Pokémon to Raichu. This power can't be used if Raichu is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Mega Thunderbolt
attacks.text: Discard all Energy attached to Raichu.

abilities.name: Red Armor
abilities.text: Prevent all damage done to Scizor by attacks from your opponent's Pokémon that have any Special Energy cards attached to them.

attacks.name: Metal Scissors
attacks.text: Does 30 damage plus 20 more damage for each Metal Energy attached to Scizor.

data.name: Kyogre & Groudon LEGEND
rules: Put this card from your hand onto your Bench only with the other half of Kyogre & Groudon LEGEND.
When this Pokémon has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Mega Tidal Wave
attacks.text: Discard the top 5 cards from your opponent's deck. This attack does 30 damage times the number of Energy cards you discarded to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Massive Eruption
attacks.text: Discard the top 5 cards from your deck. This attack does 100 damage times the number of Energy cards you discarded.

abilities.name: Opponent's Choice
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may reveal the top 2 cards of your deck and your opponent chooses 1 of them. Put that card into your hand and the other card on the bottom of your deck. This power can't be used if Slowking is affected by a Special Condition.

abilities.name: Cloud-Covered Moon
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Umbreon is your Active Pokémon, you may flip a coin. If heads, return Umbreon and all cards attached to it to your hand. This power can't be used if Umbreon is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Evoblast
attacks.text: Does 50 damage plus 10 more damage for each of your Pokémon in play that evolves from Eevee.

data.name: Rayquaza & Deoxys LEGEND
rules: Put this card from your hand onto your Bench only with the other half of Rayquaza & Deoxys LEGEND.
When this Pokémon has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Space Virus
abilities.text: If your opponent's Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from an attack of Rayquaza & Deoxys LEGEND, take 1 more Prize card.

attacks.name: Ozone Buster
attacks.text: Discard all Fire Energy attached to Rayquaza & Deoxys LEGEND.

data.name: Kyogre & Groudon LEGEND
rules: Put this card from your hand onto your Bench only with the other half of Kyogre & Groudon LEGEND.
When this Pokémon has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Mega Tidal Wave
attacks.text: Discard the top 5 cards from your opponent's deck. This attack does 30 damage times the number of Energy cards you discarded to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Massive Eruption
attacks.text: Discard the top 5 cards from your deck. This attack does 100 damage times the number of Energy cards you discarded.

data.name: Alph Lithograph
rules: Return any Stadium card in play to its player's hand!
